snippet: English Premier League champions Leicester City are likely to buy three or four players over the summer, vice chairman Aiyawatt Srivaddhanaprabha told Reuters....

headline.main: Leicester Likely to Buy 3 or 4 New Players
headline.print_headline: Leicester Likely to Buy 3 or 4 New Players

lead_paragraph: English Premier League champions Leicester City are likely to buy three or four players over the summer, vice chairman Aiyawatt Srivaddhanaprabha told Reuters.

snippet: Crystal Palace are conceding too many goals in the Premier League and must tighten up the defensive side of their game, manager Alan Pardew said on Tuesday....

headline.main: Pardew Bids to Shore Up Leaky Palace Defence
headline.print_headline: Pardew Bids to Shore Up Leaky Palace Defence

lead_paragraph: Crystal Palace are conceding too many goals in the Premier League and must tighten up the defensive side of their game, manager Alan Pardew said on Tuesday.

snippet: Eddie Howe's reputation as one of English soccer's brightest coaches was already soaring when the Bournemouth manager's credentials were further championed in an unusual public arena....

snippet: Leicester City striker Jamie Vardy said his confidence never sagged despite criticism for his goal drought which he finally ended in Saturday's 4-2 Premier League win over Manchester City....

headline.main: Criticism for Goal Drought Did Not Hurt Vardy Confidence
headline.print_headline: Criticism for Goal Drought Did Not Hurt Vardy Confidence

lead_paragraph: Leicester City striker Jamie Vardy said his confidence never sagged despite criticism for his goal drought which he finally ended in Saturday's 4-2 Premier League win over Manchester City.

snippet: Unerring last season as they churned towards an historic Premier League title, Leicester City have become wildly unreliable a few months later as their impressive midweek European exploits are in stark contrast to their domestic woes....

headline.main: Leicester's European Exploits Clouded by Domestic Woes
headline.print_headline: Leicester's European Exploits Clouded by Domestic Woes

lead_paragraph: Unerring last season as they churned towards an historic Premier League title, Leicester City have become wildly unreliable a few months later as their impressive midweek European exploits are in stark contrast to their domestic woes.

snippet: In the hours and even days after blowing the final whistle, Mark Clattenburg endures hidden anguish as the decisions made during 90 minutes of refereeing whirl through his mind....

headline.main: AP Interview: Ref Clattenburg Opens Up on Coping With Errors
headline.print_headline: AP Interview: Ref Clattenburg Opens Up on Coping With Errors

lead_paragraph: In the hours and even days after blowing the final whistle, Mark Clattenburg endures hidden anguish as the decisions made during 90 minutes of refereeing whirl through his mind.

snippet: Chelsea defender Cesar Azpilicueta has signed a new three-and-a-half-year contract that runs until 2020, the Premier League club said on their website on Tuesday....

headline.main: Chelsea Defender Azpilicueta Extends Contract to 2020
headline.print_headline: Chelsea Defender Azpilicueta Extends Contract to 2020

lead_paragraph: Chelsea defender Cesar Azpilicueta has signed a new three-and-a-half-year contract that runs until 2020, the Premier League club said on their website on Tuesday.

snippet: Arsenal striker Joel Campbell has joined Sporting on a season-long loan, the Portuguese club said on Sunday....

headline.main: Arsenal's Campbell Signs on Loan for Sporting Lisbon
headline.print_headline: Arsenal's Campbell Signs on Loan for Sporting Lisbon

lead_paragraph: Arsenal striker Joel Campbell has joined Sporting on a season-long loan, the Portuguese club said on Sunday.

snippet: Middlesbrough boss Aitor Karanka says his newly-promoted side need to continue playing the way they have over their last few matches and guard against complacency if they are to survive in the Premier League....

headline.main: Boro Must Keep Going in the Same Vein, Says Karanka
headline.print_headline: Boro Must Keep Going in the Same Vein, Says Karanka

lead_paragraph: Middlesbrough boss Aitor Karanka says his newly-promoted side need to continue playing the way they have over their last few matches and guard against complacency if they are to survive in the Premier League.

snippet: Amid the likely rotation during the busy festive program in the Premier League, there's one player Manchester United fans won't want to see out of the team....
